Class IdentifiedObjectSet<T extends IdentifiedObject>

Object
AbstractCollection<T>
AbstractSet<T>
IdentifiedObjectSet<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of objects to be included in this set.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<T>, Collection<T>, Set<T>, CheckedÂ­Container<T>, Localized
public class IdentifiedObjectSet<T extends IdentifiedObject> extends AbstractSet<T> implements CheckedContainer<T>, Localized
A lazy set of IdentifiedÂ­Object instances created from their authority codes only when first needed. This set delegates IdentifiedÂ­Object creation to the most appropriate createÂ­Foo(String) method of the AuthorityÂ­Factory given at construction time.

Elements can be added to this collection with calls to addÂ­AuthorityÂ­Code(String) for deferred object creation, or to add(IdentifiedÂ­Object) for objects that are already instantiated. This collection cannot contain two IdentifiedÂ­Object instances having the same identifier. However, the identifiers used by this class can be controlled by overriding the getÂ­AuthorityÂ­Code(IdentifiedÂ­Object) method.

Iterations over elements in this collection preserve insertion order.

Purpose

IdentifiedÂ­ObjectÂ­Set is useful mostly for implementers of authority factories rather than users. When used as the implementation of the set of coordinate operations between a pair of CRS, IdentifiedÂ­ObjectÂ­Set can improve significantly the performances because some sets contain tens of entries (e.g., transformations from ED50 (EPSG:4230) to WGS 84 (EPSG:4326)), while users typically want to look for only the first entry.

Exception handling

If the underlying factory failed to creates an object because of an unsupported operation method (NoÂ­SuchÂ­IdentifierÂ­Exception), the exception is logged at Levelâ.WARNING and the iteration continues. If the operation creation failed for any other kind of reason (FactoryÂ­Exception), then the exception is re-thrown as an unchecked BackingÂ­StoreÂ­Exception. This default behavior can be changed by overriding the isÂ­RecoverableÂ­Failure(FactoryÂ­Exception) method.

Thread safety

This class is thread-safe if the underlying factory is also thread-safe. However, implementers are encouraged to wrap in unmodifiable set if they intent to cache IdentifiedÂ­ObjectÂ­Set instances.
Since:
0.7

      protected final AuthorityFactory factory
      The factory to use for creating IdentifiedÂ­Objects when first needed. This is the authority factory given at construction time.

      public IdentifiedObjectSet(AuthorityFactory factory, Class<T> type)
      Creates an initially empty set. The set can be populated after construction by calls to addÂ­AuthorityÂ­Code(String) for deferred IdentifiedÂ­Object creation, or to add(IdentifiedÂ­Object) for already instantiated objects.
      Parameters:
      factory - the factory to use for deferred IdentifiedÂ­Object instances creation.
      type - the type of objects included in this set.

    • getAuthorityCodes

      public String[] getAuthorityCodes()
      Returns the authority codes of all IdentifiedÂ­Objects contained in this collection, in insertion order. This method does not trig the creation of any object.
      Returns:
      the authority codes in iteration order.

    • setAuthorityCodes

      public void setAuthorityCodes(String... codes)
      Sets the content of this collection to the object identified by the given codes. For any code in the given sequence, this method will preserve the corresponding IdentifiedÂ­Object instance if it was already created. Otherwise, objects will be created only when first needed.

      Use case

      This method is typically used together with getÂ­AuthorityÂ­Codes() for altering the iteration order on the basis of authority codes. If the specified codes sequence contains the same elements as the ones in the array returned by getÂ­AuthorityÂ­Codes() but in a different order, then this method just sets the new ordering.
      Parameters:
      codes - the authority codes of identified objects to store in this set.
      See Also:
      • addÂ­AuthorityÂ­Code(String)

    • addAuthorityCode

      public void addAuthorityCode(String code)
      Ensures that this collection contains an object for the specified authority code. If this collection does not contain any element for the given code, then this method will instantiate an IdentifiedÂ­Object for the given code only when first needed. Otherwise, this collection is unchanged.
      Parameters:
      code - the code authority code of the IdentifiedÂ­Object to include in this set.

    • add

      public boolean add(T object)
      Ensures that this collection contains the specified object. This collection does not allow multiple objects for the same authority code. If this collection already contains an object using the same authority code as the given object, then the old object is replaced by the new one regardless of whether the objects themselves are equal or not.
      Specified by:
      add in interface Collection<T extends IdentifiedÂ­Object>
      Specified by:
      add in interface Set<T extends IdentifiedÂ­Object>
      Overrides:
      add in class AbstractÂ­Collection<T extends IdentifiedÂ­Object>
      Parameters:
      object - the object to add to the set.
      Returns:
      true if this set changed as a result of this call.
      See Also:
      • getÂ­AuthorityÂ­Code(IdentifiedÂ­Object)

    • iterator

      public Iterator<T> iterator() throws BackingStoreException
      Returns an iterator over the objects in this set. If the iteration encounter any kind of FactoryÂ­Exception other than NoÂ­SuchÂ­IdentifierÂ­Exception, then the exception will be re-thrown as an unchecked BackingÂ­StoreÂ­Exception.

      This iterator is not thread safe â iteration should be done in a single thread. However, the iterator is robust to concurrent changes in IdentifiedÂ­ObjectÂ­Set during iteration.

      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Collection<T extends IdentifiedÂ­Object>
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<T extends IdentifiedÂ­Object>
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Set<T extends IdentifiedÂ­Object>
      Specified by:
      iterator in class AbstractÂ­Collection<T extends IdentifiedÂ­Object>
      Returns:
      an iterator over all IdentifiedÂ­Object instances in this set, in insertion order.
      Throws:
      BackingÂ­StoreÂ­Exception - if an error occurred while creating the iterator.

    • resolve

      public void resolve(int n) throws FactoryException
      Ensures that the n first objects in this set are created. This method can be invoked for making sure that the underlying factory is really capable to create at least one object. FactoryÂ­Exception (except the ones accepted as recoverable failures) are thrown as if they were never wrapped into BackingÂ­StoreÂ­Exception.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of object to resolve. If this number is equal or greater than size(), then this method ensures that all IdentifiedÂ­Object instances in this collection are created.
      Throws:
      FactoryÂ­Exception - if an object creation failed.

    • getAuthorityCode

      protected String getAuthorityCode(T object)
      Returns the identifier for the specified object. The default implementation takes the first of the following identifier which is found:
      1. An identifier allocated by the authority given by factory.getÂ­Authority().
      2. The first object identifier, regardless its authority.
      3. The first object name, regardless its authority.
      Subclasses may override this method if they want to use a different identifiers.
      Parameters:
      object - the object for which to get the authority code.
      Returns:
      the authority code of the given identified object.
      Throws:
      BackingÂ­StoreÂ­Exception - if an error occurred while fetching the authority code.

    • createObject

      protected T createObject(String code) throws FactoryException
      Creates an object for the specified authority code. This method is invoked during the iteration process if an object was not already created.
      Parameters:
      code - the code for which to create the identified object.
      Returns:
      the identified object created from the given code.
      Throws:
      FactoryÂ­Exception - if the object creation failed.
      ClassÂ­CastÂ­Exception - if the object created from the given object is not an instance of <T>.

    • isRecoverableFailure

      protected boolean isRecoverableFailure(FactoryException exception)
      Returns true if the specified exception should be handled as a recoverable failure. This method is invoked during the iteration process if the factory failed to create some objects. If this method returns true for the given exception, then the exception will be logged at Levelâ.WARNING. If this method returns false, then the exception will be re-thrown as a BackingÂ­StoreÂ­Exception.

      The default implementation applies the following rules:

      • If NoÂ­SuchÂ­AuthorityÂ­CodeÂ­Exception, returns false since failure to find a code declared in the collection would be an inconsistency. Note that this exception is a subtype of NoÂ­SuchÂ­IdentifierÂ­Exception, so it must be tested before the last case below.
      • If NoÂ­SuchÂ­IdentifierÂ­Exception, returns true because this exception is caused by an attempt to create a parameterized transform for an unimplemented operation.
      • If MissingÂ­FactoryÂ­ResourceÂ­Exception, returns true.
      • Otherwise returns false.
      Parameters:
      exception - the exception that occurred while creating an object.
      Returns:
      true if the given exception should be considered recoverable, or false if it should be considered fatal.
